item.title: Erin add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "I'm working on my own life story. I don't mean I'm putting it together; no, I'm taking it apart." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Erin add a quote by Martha Gellhorn
item.description: "I tell you loneliness is the thing to master. Courage and fear, love, death are only parts of it and can easily be ruled afterwards. If I make myself master my own loneliness there will be peace or safety: and perhaps these are the same." -- Martha Gellhorn

item.title: Erin add a quote by Nuala O'Faolain
item.description: "I did believe, from my experience of life and of looking at the world, that men hated women." -- Nuala O'Faolain

item.title: Erin add a quote by Nuala O'Faolain
item.description: "They're fathers second, Jimmy said. They're men first." -- Nuala O'Faolain

item.title: Erin add a quote by Nuala O'Faolain
item.description: "Permanence, I once copied down from a magazine, is what we all want when we can love and can be loved; change is what we want when we cannot." -- Nuala O'Faolain

item.title: Erin add a quote by China Miéville
item.description: "It had not been a long journey, but the memory of it filled her like an infection. She had felt tethered by time to the city behind her, so that the minutes stretched out taut as she moved away, and slowed the farther she got, dragging out her little voyage." -- China Miéville

item.title: Erin add a quote by Arundhati Roy
item.description: "And there it was again. Another religion turned against itself. Another edifice constructed by the human mind, decimated by human nature." -- Arundhati Roy

item.title: Erin add a quote by Arundhati Roy
item.description: "It is after all so easy to shatter a story. To break a chain of thought. To ruin a fragment of a dream being carried around carefully like a piece of porcelain. To let it be, to travel with it, as Velutha did, is much the harder thing to do." -- Arundhati Roy

item.title: Erin add a quote by Catherynne M. Valente
item.description: "...what maiden knows how the world is skewed to spare any testing of her virtue?" -- Catherynne M. Valente

item.title: Erin add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "I never use the words HUMANIST or HUMANITARIAN, as it seems to me that to be human is to be capable of the most heinous crimes in nature." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Erin add a quote by Maile Meloy
item.description: "Children were experiments, and his had failed." -- Maile Meloy

item.title: Erin add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Roughing it builds a boy's character, but only certain kinds of roughing it." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Erin add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "I will bend, I will touch the ground, or as close to it as I can get without rupture. I will lay a wreath of invisible money on her grave." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Erin add a quote by Charles de Lint
item.description: "A name can't begin to encompass the sum of all her parts. But that's the magic of names, isn't it? That the complex, contradictory individuals we are can be called up complete and whole in another mind through the simple sorcery of a name." -- Charles de Lint

item.title: Erin add a quote by Charles de Lint
item.description: "As the new work fills my notebooks, I've come to realize that the characters in my stories were so real because I really did want to get close to people, I really did want to know them. It was just easier to do it on paper, one step removed." -- Charles de Lint

item.title: Erin add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "If you expect nothing from anybody, you’re never disappointed." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Erin add a quote by Laura Kipnis
item.description: "As if all that weren't enough, factor in the whole tedious millenial saga of female virtue, modesty, shame, repression, male ineptitude...in short, a cruel combo of anatomical inheritance and sexual inhibition for the gal set; a nature-culture one-two punch, right to the female pleasure principle." -- Laura Kipnis

item.title: Erin add a quote by Jon Krakauer
item.description: "It is easy, when you are young, to believe that what you desire is no less than what you deserve, to assume that if you want something badly enough , it is your God-given right to have it...I was a raw youth who mistook passion for insight and acted according to an obscure, gap-ridden logic. I thought climbing the Devils Thumb would fix all that was wrong with my life. In the end, of course, it changed almost nothing. But I came to appreciate that mountains make poor receptacles for dreams. And I lived to tell my tale." -- Jon Krakauer

item.title: Erin add a quote by Nuala O'Faolain
item.description: "I tried not to think about it. But every so often it would burst out of me - why did he do something so unkind? What had I done to deserve it? I did believe, from my experience of life and of looking at the world, that men hated women. But there were all kinds of exceptions, and I'd have bet everything that <i>this</i> man didn't hate me, <i>this</i> woman." -- Nuala O'Faolain

item.title: Erin add a quote by Nuala O'Faolain
item.description: "The wait is long, my dream of you does not end." -- Nuala O'Faolain

item.title: Erin add a quote by Nuala O'Faolain
item.description: "But this upland pass was the right place for remembering how, when I was young, I learned to feel for the harshness underneath every soft appearance." -- Nuala O'Faolain

item.title: Erin add a quote by Nuala O'Faolain
item.description:
"But you know, there's one simple thing I see absolutely clearly, now that I am so very old.
I looked at her. The Albert Einstein hairstyle, and the bright black eyes and the sharp nose. That pallor on her face.
She put her small hand on mine.
The world is <i>wonderful</i>, she said. All its little things. It is <i>wonderful</i>." -- Nuala O'Faolain

item.title: Erin add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Being a Humanist means trying to behave decently without expectation of rewards or punishment after you are dead." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Erin add a quote by Barbara Klein Moss
item.description: "He has discovered the truths that keep writers chained to their desks: the primacy of the inner life and the sheer exhilaration of creating a world from scratch." -- Barbara Klein Moss

item.title: Erin add a quote by Carolyn Nordstrom
item.description: "Theory has all too often been a zoo in which we cage the wild beasts of violence that inhabit our worlds. We then gaze at these beasts from a safe distance, we contemplate them, we theorize how they would act in their own environments - and we never go to those environments where the beasts roam freely to actually check our theories. To do so would be disastrous. It would point out the absurdity of our analyses and the illusion of safety so carefully crafted." -- Carolyn Nordstrom

item.title: Erin add a quote by Alice B. Sheldon
item.description: "Being, I imagine, must be very simple. It is Becoming which is so messy and which I am all for." -- Alice B. Sheldon

item.title: Erin add a quote by Martha Gellhorn
item.description: "The only way I can pay back for what fate and society have handed me is to try, in minor totally useless ways, to make an angry sound against injustice." -- Martha Gellhorn

item.title: Erin add a quote by Martha Gellhorn
item.description: "What the trees can do handsomely-greening and flowering, fading and then the falling of leaves-human beings cannot do with dignity, let alone without pain." -- Martha Gellhorn

item.title: Erin add a quote by Mark Z. Danielewski
item.description: "Passion has little to do with euphoria and everything to do with patience. It is not about feeling good. It is about endurance. Like patience, passion comes from the same Latin root: pati. It does not mean to flow with exuberance. It means to suffer." -- Mark Z. Danielewski

item.title: Erin add a quote by Martha Gellhorn
item.description: "A broken heart is such a shabby thing, like poverty and failure and the incurable diseases which are also deforming. I hate it and am ashamed of it, and I must somehow repair this heart and put it back into its normal condition, as a tough somewhat scarred but operating organ." -- Martha Gellhorn
